objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: Primary author/publisher of the report and YARA rules; provides analysis, findings, and recommendations.

objects.name: First-stage hosting domain
objects.description: Used in the spear-phishing infection chain to host the signed first-stage downloader.

objects.name: Second-stage hosting domain
objects.description: Domain used by the first-stage to download the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL.

objects.name: DAMASCENED PEACOCK delivery URL
objects.description: Observed URL serving the DAMASCENED PEACOCK stage in this campaign.

objects.name: C2 domain
objects.description: Configured command-and-control domain; malware communicates over HTTP on port 8080.

objects.name: C2 HTTP endpoint
objects.description: HTTP C2 endpoint per observed beacon (POST / with custom payload) on port 8080.

objects.name: COM hijack key
objects.description: Registry key hijacked by the malware to load its payload into explorer.exe.

objects.name: KeyProv.dll
objects.description: Downloaded third-stage payload written to disk and loaded via COM Hijack into explorer.exe.

objects.name: KeyStore directory
objects.description: Directory used by the malware to store the downloaded third-stage DLL (KeyProv.dll).

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of the signed first-stage downloader (Original Filename: PortDocFormat.exe) used to deliver DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of the signed first-stage downloader (Original Filename: PortDocFormat.exe) used to deliver DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of the signed first-stage downloader (Original Filename: PortDocFormat.exe) used to deliver DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of DAMASCENED PEACOCK second-stage DLL responsible for downloading the final stage and setting the COM hijack.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of DAMASCENED PEACOCK second-stage DLL responsible for downloading the final stage and setting the COM hijack.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of DAMASCENED PEACOCK second-stage DLL responsible for downloading the final stage and setting the COM hijack.

objects.name: damascened peacock
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a lightweight, staged downloader targeting Windows observed in a late-2024 spear-phishing campaign. It is implemented as a 32-bit (x86) DLL with a single export (DllExport), loaded by a signed first-stage executable and executed within the first-stage process. It downloads a final payload from its C2 (apimonger.com:8080), writes it to %LOCALAPPDATA%\KeyStore\KeyProv.dll, and achieves execution via a COM hijack by modifying the InprocServer32 value for CLSID {F82B4EF1-93A9-4DDE-8015-F7950A1A6E31} to the downloaded DLL, then terminating explorer.exe to trigger the hijack. It uses XOR-based string obfuscation and an API hashing scheme with dynamic resolution of Win32 APIs for defense evasion. It checks if the system is 32-bit or 64-bit to request either get_update_manager32 or get_update_manager64. Communications use WinHTTP over HTTP on port 8080. The sample beacons to apimonger.com and was delivered via spear-phishing links that downloaded a signed first stage from temp[.]sh and then pulled the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL from journalctl[.]website.

objects.name: doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (portdocformat.exe first stage)
objects.description: A signed first-stage Windows downloader written in Rust that masquerades as a PDF (filename and icon). When executed, it downloads and displays a decoy PDF and downloads/launches the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL from journalctl[.]website. Metadata: size 256,384 bytes; MD5 e0c48d62c4d484b6dd4a601970df5d0e; SHA-1 1bd5b9fec7ccc29144989203c3b15a10c9c22a76; SHA-256 31a8a2762b42a1fe4be2aed9d112a169f791bd86a85e68d738aea51312096442; compile time 03/10/2024 11:23:58; signed by CN = FUTURICO LLC (Serial = 4132BA96E2D9FEEB537DA74C).

objects.name: UK Ministry of Defence (MOD)
objects.description: Targeted organization that detected the late-2024 spear-phishing campaigns delivering the malware.

objects.name: Talos
objects.description: Cited as documenting the RustyClaw variant related to the RomCom malware family referenced in the report.

objects.name: Palo Alto
objects.description: Cited as documenting the SnipBot variant related to the RomCom malware family referenced in the report.

objects.name: GlobalSign nv-sa
objects.description: Issuer organization listed on the code signing certificate used for the first-stage downloader.

objects.name: GlobalSign GCC R45 EV CodeSigning CA 2020
objects.description: Certificate Authority identified as the issuing CA for the code signing certificate used on the first stage.

objects.name: FUTURICO LLC
objects.description: Subject/owner named on the code signing certificate used to sign the first-stage downloader.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Targets a code pattern which is used to resolve
APIs in the first stage which loads DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "1bd5b9fec7ccc29144989203c3b15a10c9c22a76"

    strings:

    $ = {56 31 C0 85 D2 74 1D 0F B6 31 41 4A 69 F6 [4] 0F AF F6 C1

C6 10 31 C6 0F AF F6 C1 C6 10 89 F0 EB DF 5E C3}
    condition:

    (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

and all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets a code pattern in DAMASCENED
PEACOCK which sees the resolved pointer for WinHttpConnect retrieved from
a struct, arguments pushed e.g. 8080 as the port, and then a call."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = {8B 85 90 00 00 00 6A 00 68 90 1F 00 00 FF 76 34 FF 33 FF D0}
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the code in DAMASCENED PEACOCK
used for generating an API hash. The rule is agnostic of the constants
used to generate the hash."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ =
{8D0C0669C9[4]8D5201C1C9??81C1[4]03C1C1C8??0FAFC60FBE3203C08BC8C1C8??C1C9
??85F6}
    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the original name and export
name in DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = "XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll"
        $ = "DllExport"
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: Gather Victim Host Information
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK checks whether the victim host is 32-bit or 64-bit to determine the appropriate next stage to download.

objects.name: Phishing: Spearphishing Link
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage that is delivered via a link in an email.

objects.name: User Execution: Malicious File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage which is reliant upon the user running the file.

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication: Component Object Model
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK achieves execution for the 3rd stage it downloads by COM hijacking explorer.exe.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Encrypted/Encoded File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK XOR encodes configuration strings used throughout.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Dynamic API Resolution
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK uses an API hashing algorithm combined with dynamic resolution of Win32 APIs to obfuscate functionality.

objects.name: Subvert Trust Controls: Code Signing
objects.description: The first stage of the malware is signed, allowing DAMASCENED PEACOCK to execute within a signed, malicious process.

objects.name: Masquerading
objects.description: The first stage of DAMASCENED PEACOCK is an executable with an icon and filename indicating it is a PDF.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK communicates with the command and control server over HTTP.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Damascened Peacock
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. damascened peacock.
